adviseScripts.text: Hey, Pal, how about sparring? You and me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text:
Come on. For fun.
You're not chicken, are you?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I promise I'll go easy on you.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: An amateur going easy on a pro?
Please, be gentle with me.
Oooh! You seem confident.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Get ready, then. I'll give you everything I've got!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Mmm... Okay.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: You're more of a chicken than I thought, Pal.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Really surprising.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I spend time with Milk, sparring.
Hey, you ever put milk in your coffee?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: What's your milk-to-coffee ratio?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Milk 9, coffee 1.
Milk 5, coffee 5.
Can you even call that coffee?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Right? That's the best ratio.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I both like coffee and milk, so having it in equal parts is just right!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: That's my kind of coffee.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Milk over some coffee.
I love hand-to-hand combat, but nobody around here can match my muscle. It gets kinda lonely.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: You know of any worthy opponents?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Milk.
Sugar.
Me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Hah! Right. The only worthy opponent is me. Makes sense.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: After all, I'm the best there is.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Sugar?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Do you know what she'd do if she got really fired up?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: She'd run me over with her bike.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I study hand-to-hand combat with Milk.
Sometimes, I get assignments where I have to scavenge really carefully.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I hate them so much.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Can't I just get requests where I get to destroy things?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: It's worth a shot.
But you're a scavenger, not a destroyer.
Oh! So you think I should give it a try?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: ... That kind of request is very rare.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: It's perfect for the adventure-hungry Nikke.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Hmmm. That's true.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Well, if I wanted to become a destroyer, I would have found another squad.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Milk about being delicate.
Hey. You know our cafe?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: It's just as good as that other one in the Ark.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: That's why I want to hire an ad agency for it. Any recommendations?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Mustang.
The Talentum squad.
That could work.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: That will absolutely work.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: They are pretty amazing.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text:
But, how do I say this...
They lack a certain explosive quality.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I will put them on the list for now.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I talk to Milk about ways to promote the cafe.
Yesterday, I got up in the middle of the night to drink some water.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: But, I stepped on Frima's back. She was just sleeping there on the floor.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: She got really worked up about it. But, is it really my fault?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: It is your fault.
It's Frima's fault.
What did I do wrong?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Isn't it common sense not to sleep on the last step of the stairs? Or anywhere on the stairs, for that matter?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Right? Don't you think so?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: It's her fault for falling asleep on the stairs.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: If she does it again, I'll sit on her and crush her.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I talk to Milk about Frima's sleeping habits.
Sugar is so noisy.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Well, not Sugar herself. It's her bike.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I can't stand that annoying *vroooooom* sound.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Let's put a silencer on it!
Let's break her bike!
Hey! That's a great idea.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: That'll put a stop to the noise for sure.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Isn't that... overkill?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: You know how much Sugar cares about her bike.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I have a conversation with Milk about Sugar's bike.
Hey, Pal...
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Do you think I look... uh... violent?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Yes. Like an angry gorilla.
Not at all. I think you're cute.
You...!! What did you just say!?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Do you want to taste my gorilla punch!?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: What's with this all of a sudden?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Y-you shouldn't say "cute" to a grown lady, you loser!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I spend time with Milk, teasing her.
Do you know what a Hadouken is?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: They say if you get good enough at martial arts, you can shoot a wave of energy out of your bare hands.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I wanna learn how to do that...
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: But aren't guns much better?
The only way to find out is to train.
I guess you're right.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: A bullet is probably stronger than anything I can make from my hands.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: You want me to just train without knowing any particular method?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: ... Stupid. That'll be a waste of time.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I research special martial arts techniques with Milk.
Sugar has her bike.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Frima has her sofa.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I also need something as my mount.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: A sofa isn't a mount.
What about me?
Well she sure rides it like one.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Who knows? It might fly off into the sky someday.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Oh? You're saying I can ride on you, Pal?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Hmm... a Pal you can ride, huh...
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Uh... wait. That came off a little naughty.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I talk with Milk about mounts.
Hey, Pal...
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: This is just a question, okay?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: What would you think of me wearing a dress?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I just might fall in love with one glance.
It would be hilarious.
R-really?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Ah, you know, I just happened to get one, so...!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I will go try it on and you will...!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text:
No way! You absolutely won't!
Forget I said anything!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Hilarious? You think it would be funny?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Do I look like I'm joking?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Do you want me to give you something to laugh about? Do you?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I spend time with Milk, talking about her looks.
If I wasn't a Scavenger,
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: what do you think I'd be doing?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Boxing.
Unemployed, most likely.
That doesn't sound too bad.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I'd fight my way to the top, win the prize money, then live high off the hog for the next few months.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: After that, I'd... Actually, should I even be thinking this far out?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: ... Are you done?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: This job isn't the be-all and end-all in my life, you know.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: There's more to me than that. Never mind, forget I said anything.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Milk and I talk about her future prospects.
All right, let's flip a coin.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Heads, you've gotta grant one of my wishes. Tails, I grant one of yours.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Okay?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Go for it.
First I want to make sure it's not a double-sided coin.
All right, let's do this.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Milk lightly flips the coin.
Heads!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: That's too bad for you, buddy. Looks like you'll be spending the day with me.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Hey! What kind of person do you think I am?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: You really think I'd use a cheap trick like rigging the coin?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: You ever considered that it could just be a bum coin?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Milk and I start bickering with one another.
The café has been a ghost town lately. No idea why...
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: What do you think is causing this?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: It's because of Frima.
It's because of you.
I was thinking the same thing.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: That lazy oaf never serves a single customer and just sleeps all day.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: This place is so dead, there might as well be buzzards circling above our heads.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Come again? Are you trying to start a fight?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: What did I ever do? I get into a few fights with customers,
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: and suddenly I'm the sole reason that business is suffering?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Milk and I racked our brains as to why the café was losing customers.
What do you think of a girl who does martial arts?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Be as objective as possible.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I think it's awesome.
I think it's a little intimidating.
No kidding?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I guess most people would feel the same way.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Why is my face getting so red all of a sudden?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: What the hell?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: So are you saying that I should give up on martial arts? Is that it?!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: It's not like I smack you around or anything. On the contrary, I've protected you more times than I can count!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I talk to Milk about the correlation between martial arts and attractiveness.
If I punched someone, how many weeks do you think they would need to recover?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I'm not sure about weeks... days would be more like it.
I don't know... 12 weeks?
What was that? Say that to my face!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Get over here so I can bop you one.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Wowee, you really think my punch is that powerful?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: 12 weeks is a long time though... what if they ended up croaking?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Eh, whatever, you hit the nail on the head at any rate. You're a good egg!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Milk and I talk more about her punching skills.
I had someone tell me today that it might be beneficial for me to change how I talk to people.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I told them, "I think punching you right in the mouth would be beneficial for me."
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Do you think there's something wrong with how I talk to people?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I get a big kick out of how you talk to me.
I think you could afford to tone down the aggression...
You always have the right answer, Pal.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I wasn't intending on changing it anyways.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: There's no need to!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I think how I'm talking now is plenty friendly.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: But it doesn't look like you agree with me...
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Milk and I discuss how she could possibly change her way of speaking.
Hey, are you up for a match?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: The loser has to take a sucker punch. How about it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Just hit me and get it over with.
Agreed.
Pfft, boooorrring.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Have you always been this weak?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: All right, this'll be fun!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Let's see who has to be the punching bag.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Game on!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I tried with all my might not to lose to Milk.
I've been thinking about entering a martial arts competition.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: One's being held near here soon.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: If you do enter, you'll be the champion for sure.
There are a lot of people who are great at martial arts.
You think so too?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Now I'm really interested.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: come again? Are you trying to start a fight?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: What of it?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: I know there are a lot of capable fighters out there, but I won't lose to any of them.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Milk and I looked for additional martial arts competitions.
I had a Milk Tea yesterday, and it was delicious as always.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Anything's good if it's got milk in it.
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Milk thistle is pretty gross.
I also like milk.
... Is that supposed to be a joke?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: You need to work on your sense of humor... talk about corny...
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: So you like milk too?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Wait, are you talking about the drink, or me?
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Damn you! Be more clear next time!
adviseScripts.speaker: Milk

adviseScripts.text: Milk and I have fun chit-chatting.
